member.name: IPropertySetStorage.Create
member.summary: The Create method creates and opens a new property set in the property set storage object.
member.param: The FMTID of the property set to be created. For information about FMTIDs that are well-known and predefined in the Platform SDK, seePredefined Property Set Format Identifiers.

A pointer to the initial class identifier CLSID for this property set. May be NULL, in which case it is set to all zeroes. The CLSID is the CLSID of a class that displays and/or provides programmatic access to the property values. If there is no such class, it is recommended that the FMTID be used.
An access mode in which the newly created property set is to be opened, taken from certain values of STGM_Constants, as described in the following Remarks section.
A pointer to the output variable that receives the interface pointer.
member.returns: This method supports the standard return value E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following:

member.name: IPropertySetStorage.Delete
member.summary: The Delete method deletes one of the property sets contained in the property set storage object.
member.param: FMTID of the property set to be deleted.
member.returns: This method supports the standard return value E_UNEXPECTED, in addition to the following:

member.name: IPropertySetStorage.Enum
member.summary: The Enum method creates an enumerator object which contains information on the property sets stored in this property set storage. On return, this method supplies a pointer to the pointer on the enumerator object.
member.param: Pointer to pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the newly created enumerator object.
member.returns: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: IPropertySetStorage.Open
member.summary: The Open method opens a property set contained in the property set storage object.
member.param: The format identifier (FMTID) of the property set to be opened. For more information about well-known and predefined FMTIDs in the Platform SDK, seePredefined Property Set Format Identifiers.

The access mode in which the newly created property set is to be opened. These flags are taken from STGM Constants. Flags that may be used and their meanings in the context of this method are described in the following Remarks section.
A pointer to the pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the requested property storage subobject.
member.returns: This method supports the standard return value E_UNEXPECTED, in addition to the following:
